summary: Likes to work in ambitious teams and with motivated people. I seek a challenge in everything I do. I am not inexperienced with leadership roles, And aspire to one day be able to work in a great team of people to make games that I would once have been amazed by as a teenager.

projects.title: Personal Project - Blood League
projects.description: Inspired by my short term game Head-On, we decided to make a full-blown game out of it.

contributors.headline: Indie Game Developer at Team Broodrooster

projects.title: Project ProveIT
projects.description:
in this project I am working on two different assignments at the same time, the first one is a maya plugin that will make animations a lot smoother so that inaccurate motion capture data could be made smooth again. I was team leader for this particular assignment, working with three other team members.

The other assignment was to make a library usable for app developers for both android as well as iOS using MoSync, so that they would be able to use voice recognition to control their app as well as be able to have a voice response from the app back to the user. both the commands and the responses should be customizable by the user. I worked together with two other team members to create this product.

projects.title: Project Business Unit Game Technology
projects.description: In this project, the team created an AI extension for the irrlicht game engine, and a game to showcase the extension. The most interesting feature of the game was a system that balances the game automatically by changing numeric values on its own.

projects.title: Project Stella Incognita: Networking Library
projects.description: Together with some exchange students from Finland and America, we developed an extension for the open source Irrlicht engine that handles the sending and receiving of data between computers.

projects.title: Game Design 2 - short-term game - Head-On
projects.description:
this is the second game I made for my Game Design 2 Class, this time we focused on the following three subjects: Dynamics, Narrative and Polish. Just as before I had two weeks for each assignment, so here we go!

I came up for the idea when thinking of dynamics, our first assignment. It meant we had to create a game where players would be switching play styles during play, I chose for a 2 player 2D platformer where players would try and shoot each other with bullets they had to pick up individually. this made the players switch between collecting bullets, shooting bullets and dodging bullets very quickly, i added triple jumping to make it more fast-paced and action-oriented.

after dynamics I got working on Narrative, I chose to go for pacing instead of an actual story as I thought it would support the game in the best way. both players got 5 lives, once all of them are depleted, that player loses. each time a player loses another life he will start running a little faster and jump a little higher, to make it seem like he is fighting for his life more and more desperately. this is also visualized by drops of sweat on his head. And the more lives a player lost, the more he will be sweating. After losing 3 lives that player will now no longer shoot in the direction the player moves in, but instead shoot in the direction the other player is, making in possible to shoot while on the run.

And finally polish, in this subject we were to make the game more juicy. To let the game make the player feel like a bad-ass. I did this by adding sprites to the characters, adding camera shakes, gun sounds and music (made by Immediate Music, I take no credit).

projects.title: Project Entertainment Game - Trapped
projects.description:
In this project, we worked to create a game for entertainment proposes. we pitched ideas and formed teams before starting to work on the product itself, so the idea was fully ours.

Our game is called Trapped, developed completely in C++ using the OpenGL Library called Ogre3D C-Audio Knet.

here is a short summary of what the game is:
the game is a multiplayer asynchronous game where a survivor tries to collect food while zombies try to kill him, while the survivor has a scanner that allows him to see the zombies on his mini-map, the zombies are able to work together and track the survivor down by smelling the survivor once they have collected enough brains. the full description of the game can be found in the readme.txt in the downloadable zip file. complete with instructions on how to play the game and a more in detail description including some of the feedback loops and features that cannot fit within this description.

I personally was responsible for some of the design, various items, parts of the UI, various gameplay elements such as sprinting, but my biggest contribution was the random level generator. 

My level generator generated a map with customizable diameters and amounts of different things within the level such as bunkers, items and food. it would make sure these were never placed close to each other regardless of the parameters it was given, it would make sure that no parts of the level were cut of from the rest, and there would be no dead ends. I also wrote an algorithm to make sure there would be no choke points in the level, but that was turned off due to design decisions.

contributors.headline: Indie Game Developer at Team Broodrooster

projects.title: Studium Excellentie
projects.description:
This is a program that top students of different creative studies within the Hogeschool van Amsterdam sign up for. It is an extra project that gives its participants  a better sense of context around their work and learn much more different approaches and theories related to technologies and creative work.

During One year we have been working on predicting future scenario's, analyzing trends and then coming up with the most preferred product given the provided information.which was a new business model for a dutch website similar to groupon.com called amigoamigo.nl.

We also received talks from several people from the world of trend watchers and designers (although no game designers).

projects.title: Game Design 2 - short-term game - Starship
projects.description:
this game is the result of a few weeks of game developement for one of my subjects; game developement 2. during this period, we would produce a small game over the course of six weeks, every two weeks we would present what we had so far, and for each presentation we had to show how we have implemented a new fundamental design choice. in this game, user experience, level design and mechanics were implemented.

User experience focused on what emotions were supposed to drive the player, in my case I went for something where the player has to fight for survival and keep this up for as long as possible. so i decided to give the classic game helicopter a spin where the player has to also manage their speed and they have to keep ahead of an exploding star as a starship while dodging asteroids.

Level Design, this was all about implementing a key-lock mechanism into your game. since the levels in this game are randomly generated I chose to give the game a win and lose state where the player needs to get three fuel cells and then press the spacebar to warp away to safety, giving you the points you deserve. but you can also keep playing to gather points at the risk of dying and not getting your points.

Mechanics, this was all about feedback loops, I had a few already like the wall of fire that speeds up, the more asteroids that will be spawning the longer you play. and eventually; the ability to play after you have gathered all your fuel cells to get a lot more points.

Up arrow to move up, right and left arrows are to increase and decrease your speed and press spacebar when you have gathered enough fuel cells to make your FTL Jump.

projects.title: Project Get Connected
projects.description:
A project where we were tasked with making a toy for a child around the age of 3 that suffered from Pitt Hopkins Syndrome. We came up with the LEDMat. A device that would lay on the ground with the child on top. it has pressure sensors and LED's built into the foam surface and allowed the child to play multiple games.

in the last couple of weeks of developement we ran into problems with parts not getting delivered in time and unfortunately the project was never completely finished hardware wise. It was however, graded sufficient as the team operated above the level expected.

projects.title: Project Outfit
projects.description:
This is a shop management game written in Action Script 3 that was integrated into facebook where you could design your own clothing, complete daily challenges, visit the shops of your facebook friends and expand your brand.

The game allowed you to create a shop and fill it sims-style with furnature where you would be able to sell clothing you have designed yourself in an in-game editor.

The achievement I am most proud of was making an AI pathfinding system for the customers that visited your store, they would search for clothing, decide if they wanted to buy it, maybe move on the the next piece of clothing or decide to buy what the customer was currently holding and move to the counter and then out of the door again. This system was created by me without any previous pathfinding knowledge and I designed a system on my own that, in hindsight, closely resembled the Dijkstra algorithm. I am also proud that I was able to do this without any knowledge of Recursive functions, which I learned one year later.

Furthermore I was responsible for all the math that calculated if a customer would buy an item and some of the design.

contributors.headline: Indie Game Developer at Team Broodrooster

projects.title: Students in Motion
projects.description: This was a project for school where we were tasked with making a video that would make a district of Amsterdam look more fun. This video was the result of one week (although this could be done much faster, the week also consisted of visiting companies etc.) although I did the camerawork, directing, editing and special effects for this project

projects.title: Project EXPO
projects.description:
The first project made for school, we created a Multi-Media Experience. When the Team leader abandoned the study without telling, I replaced him.

Our team was among the best five teams out of around 100.

We developed four mini-games that could be played using a joystick and a button (both were phidgets). It used two laptops, each with their own beamer that the player could see. one of them played video's that shows information on the subject of the game, which runs on the other beamer. The programming languages used were Actionscript 3, Java, a very small amount of C++ and also had some games that were made with gamemaker.

contributors.headline: Indie Game Developer at Team Broodrooster

projects.title: School Project: IT Management Game
projects.description:
This is a game I made as part of a school project. The goal of the project was to attract attention to a fictional company called ITopia. The text is all in Dutch.
The game is made in ActionScript 3/Flash. All the programming is done by Kevin Dekkers. All the artwork is done by Alex Ates.

The goal of the game is to sort "tasks" (blocks) that fall from the sky, and give them to the right IT-guy. When you are done, you get to see how ITopia would have played the game.

This game is one of the four mini-games developed for project EXPO

contributors.headline: Indie Game Developer at Team Broodrooster

projects.title: Far Cry 2 Map - Shardlands
projects.description: A map that consists of a handful of flying rocks connected to eachother via bridges or smaller rocks that can be used as stepping stones. It can be played as a Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag and Conquest map with lots of multiple ways to reach the other team. It had a cool aesthetic at dusk with each shard having a different theme to it, from a floating village to a set of caves in a large flying rock.

projects.title: Far Cry 2 Map - Forsaken Island
projects.description: A very dark Island at midnight with a fort in the middle. It has a very grim setting with dead carcasses and garbage laying around and poor visibility during a storm. It is a free for all map, making the experience for the players even more paranoid and claustrophobic.

projects.title: Mod for TES 4:Oblivion - dark brotherhood listener improvements
projects.description:
The first mod I ever published, I used other modding tools before. but those were for personal entertainment and exploration. 

This mod adds a new set of rooms in an existing area unlocked by a key given to you during an existing quest. In this project i have applied skills like level design, basic scripting and I created an AI path finding grid for NPC's to walk on.

profile_positions.description: Among my various responsibilities at Ronimo Games were the following: creating patches for Awesomenauts on Playstation 4 and Xbox One, working on UI and gameplay for Awesomenauts in C++, creating Tools for cheater report handling in C# as well as creation of Photoshop scripts in Javascript.
profile_positions.title: Game Programmer

profile_positions.description: During my internship at Ronimo, I worked on a procedural level art generator. To generate art for user-generated maps.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: While working on Age of Wonders 3, I was a UI and Gameplay programmer in C++ and UI programmer in AS3
